website_summaries.verdict: Loving the Arrowhead is not that difficult to do. Indeed, with its top-tier precision and amazing sensitivity, fondness for this sport climbing wonder can come quite naturally.That said, this remarkable all-rounder still comes with a few flaws, the most worrying of which has to be its inability to keep its shape over time. Nevertheless, the Arrowhead has enough send-worthy aces up its sleeve to be considered a confidence-inspiring climbing companion.
pros: Many customers find their Five Ten Arrowhead climbing shoes exceptionally precise
Its all-around performance is very impressive, based on a decent number of reports
According to several owners, the Arrowhead is an excellent tool for sport-type ascents
Some Five Ten Arrowhead reviews speak of the rock shoe’s incredible sensitivity
This climbing shoe from 5.10 offers high amounts of grip, say about a handful of those who have tested it
A couple of those who have climbed in the shoe several times adore its great ability to get into cracks
cons: Based on a small number of reviews, the Five Ten Arrowhead loses its form and becomes too soft too soon
A few customers are rather irked by its baggy heel
The Arrowhead is not satisfactory in the area of toe hooking, according to less than a handful of wearers

customer_reviews.title: the amount of flex and sensitivity make them relatively easy to wear once on
customer_reviews.text: These are an aggressive version of the anasazi verde. Similar sensitivity and locked on heel, but with a sharp point and curve and velcro closure. Sizing will be a little smaller than similar of the anasazi line, perhaps a half size bigger is needed if you've worn the anasazi vcs. However, the amount of flex and sensitivity make them relatively easy to wear once on, and a slight stretch after a couple sessions makes these wonderful for a few hard attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Laschober

customer_reviews.title: However they are such great shoes - just don't keep them on for too ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it on sale so it was a plus to begin with. The shoe was as aggressive as I thought it would be but it being my first aggressive shoe, it wrecked my feet. However they are such great shoes - just don't keep them on for too long or it will hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only shoes I can wear
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of the same shoe. The fact that I'm buying a second pair says enough. They fit well. Great grip on the toes. Enough of a curve in the toe to make a difference climbing overhangs and toe hooking but not enough to be uncomfortably painful. Velcro makes it fit nice and snug. Only gripe is the heel doesn't fit firmly around my heel but it doesn't hinder me for the occasional heel hook. I'm mostly an indoor lead climber/boulderer FYI. Limited outdoor climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy them, but buy them a full size up
customer_reviews.text: Used them 1 time in the gym so they still need broken in. But so far, they're exactly what you would expect from a five ten Anasazi shoe-good construction, great sole, and solid performance. Great choice for a first show with downturned toe, but buy them large. I wear a size 10.5 Anasazi, and the 11.5 arrowhead fits tight but not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Fits very tight at first, but great.
customer_reviews.text: I got the same size as my street shoes. This fits very small at first. It was so painful that I thought about exchanging it. I had to use shoe stretcher and hair dryer to stretch it out over night. After that, this pair became my favorite. Fits like a tight socks and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Takuto

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome climbing shoes! Just used it for the first time in a sandstone sector. Nice grip, good precision. Fits perfectly on my feet. I wear a 7 street shoes and purchased a 7 on this, it feels exactly the way I wanted. I hope it doesn't strech much, because it's really perfect the way it is now. Although the color is called orange, I think it's red instead. (picture by Roniel Fonseca)
customer_reviews.author: Beto Martyres

customer_reviews.title: Just as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple pairs of FiveTen shoes and these are just as great as I thought they would be. Although built on a different last than my previous shoes (FiveTen VCS Stonelands), these fit just as comfortably. They break in relatively quickly, providing an amazing fit. I definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Guinyard

customer_reviews.title: Such an incredible price and they arrived on time and ...
customer_reviews.text: Such an incredible price and they arrived on time and as expected. Paid about $50 less than cheapest possible price elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing show
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes, they're genuine and definitely a better shoe. I'm new to climbing and these are a little on the aggressive side but they have helped my footwork heaps and tonnes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but so far I'm pretty happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I'm still in the break-in period, but so far I'm pretty happy with them. I had a pair of Anasazi's that I wore religiously the past year. I find that the Arrowheads have a lot of what I liked about the Anasazis, but the footwork feels way more precise. The slight downturn of the toe definitely helps when bouldering on overhung routes, but doesn't seem to hinder their performance on slabbier routes. So far they fit smaller than expected, but seem to have a bit of stretch in them.
customer_reviews.author: bustacapyoyoyo

customer_reviews.title: Simply perfect! great all round and super comfortable from the ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply perfect! great all round and super comfortable from the first use. I dont think I've ever been in such a comfortable aggressive shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Eran Naot

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe but SMALL
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are built well. The tongue has more padding than most climbing shoes, which is nice. My family has owned multiple pairs of climbing shoes by different manufacturers and 5.10 biking/parkour shoes. These were considerably smaller than expected. In terms of US sizing, I suggest ordering at least 1/2 size larger; I had to return my first order and purchase a full US size larger.
customer_reviews.author: CW Mof...

customer_reviews.title: Size up considerably.
customer_reviews.text: Besides being to small in length, the toe box was too narrow for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These new kicks have done wonders for my climbing ability!
customer_reviews.author: vaughn

customer_reviews.title: I have a pair of the regular Anasazi which I really like and wanted this pair for nice comfortable gym shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: Sized very small! I have a pair of the regular Anasazi which I really like and wanted this pair for nice comfortable gym shoe so I ordered a size and a half bigger shoe. What I got was even a smaller shoe which I will probably have to return.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: BAD SIZING
customer_reviews.text: Well Idk what else to try- Ive Tried Every size with Five Ten and NOTHING FITS- I wear size 13 street shoe- and have allways climbed in 12.5s in 5.10 size 12.5,13,and 13.5 and MURDEROUS small- and when I tried size 14- it jumps about 3 inches-- Absolutly a waste if you have big feet- This is my 4th return- and will no longer Buy Five Tens -looks like its back to evolvs- and la sportivas. Bummer too- as 5-10 makes what seems like good shoes.......
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes for everything, they are my go to. I have two pair and am planning on getting a third. Have taken down overhangs, roof problems, slabs, faces, edging, everything but crack climbing. These shoes are superb. If Five Ten discon'd them I would snap up a few pairs for sure. The blackwing is like the more aggressive little brother to these wise old sages. Great heel cup, just enough sensitivity and stiffness. Perfect shoes for me!
customer_reviews.author: maharaja

product_meta.title: Five Ten Mens Anasazi Arrowhead-M Anasazi Arrowhead-m
product_meta.description: Built on a 4G Anasazi last, this Scarpa climbing shoe molds to the foot and grips with ease.
feature_bullets: High arch and downturned toe construction
Built on a 4G Anasazi last, this Scarpa climbing shoe molds to the foot and grips with ease.
